title: I meet a professor a year ago but I forgot to send a thank-you email. How to ask about a new research project with him again? Can anybody give an idea? - Quora

response.answer_text: I may or may not like you, and as a result you may or may not get invited to BBQs. However, if this influences my academic decisions, I would act pretty unprofessional. If you have proven yourself to be a reliable collaborator, I will work with you, even if there are personal problems. If we spent hours on the beach talking about late renaissance music, but you are a mediocre mathematician, I will not work with you. And thank you e-mails go right into trash. Not as annoying as head of department spam, but more annoying than penis enlargement spam. So don't think too much, just ask about another project, or suggest one yourself. The answer will depend on lots of factors, but not on aa forgotten thank you mail.
``Hi Professor. We met a year ago, but didn’t keep in touch. I’m really interested in doing a research project on X, if you are still working on X.’’
